title: CLASSIC OpenDrawer File Metadata (Draft)
description: JSON Schema generated from the '(C1) file metadata-draft' sheet of 'CLASSIC OpenDrawer_data model_draft (1).xlsx'.

projectShortName.description: The abbreviated name of the CLASSIC projects

studyKey.description: The short acronym for a study name in a URL-friendly format

fileFormat.description: Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software

grant.description: Grant number including activity code, institute code, and serial number (e.g. U01MH103392)

resourceType.description: The type of resource being stored and annotated

dataTypeAll.description: Types of input/output data in bioinformatics pipelines

dataSubtype.description: Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.

isModelSystem.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not a file has data from a model system

familyStudyParticipant.description: Indicates whether or not a file has data from a human participant involved in a family or multigenerational study

metadataType.description: For files of dataSubtype: metadata, a description of the type of metadata in the file.

resultType.description: The result type used for result methods.

dataFormat.description: The type of data format by the content of the data that is represented.

experimentalDesign.description: The design of an experiment intended to test a hypothesis, and describe or explain empirical data obtained under various experimental conditions.

entity.description: A distinct, identifiable object or concept that is the subject of data collection, analysis, or result reporting. In the context of analysis and results-level metadata, an entity typically corresponds to the primary unit of analysis, such as a file, image, instrument, or computational result, with which metadata and results are associated. This could be a SynapseID, a DOI, or a stable URL to the experimental data from which the results are derived.
